security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only documentation and test pattern references. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond reading its own content. The skill provides guidance for generating test code but does not execute any operations itself.

content.user_title: Generate backend tests with smart detection
content.value_statement: Writing backend tests takes significant time and requires knowledge of test frameworks. This skill analyzes your code structure, detects your testing setup, and generates comprehensive tests covering happy paths, error cases, and edge cases.
actual_capabilities: Detects test framework from package.json (Jest, Vitest, Mocha)
Analyzes file type and chooses appropriate test approach
Generates integration tests with Supertest and in-memory MongoDB
Creates unit tests with mocked dependencies for services and models
Includes proper setup, teardown, and cleanup patterns
Covers edge cases like validation errors, duplicates, race conditions
limitations: Does not execute tests or modify your codebase directly
Requires user to review and copy generated tests
Does not install dependencies or configure test environment
Cannot test external APIs or third-party services

use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive tests for Express routes, controllers, and services in minutes

use_cases.title: Ensure edge case coverage
use_cases.description: Create tests for validation errors, authentication failures, and boundary conditions

use_cases.title: Maintain test consistency
use_cases.description: Establish uniform test patterns across multiple backend services

prompt_templates.title: Basic test request
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate tests for a route file
prompt_templates.prompt: Write tests for the Express route file at [file path]

prompt_templates.title: With framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Jest tests for [file path] using integration tests with mongodb-memory-server

prompt_templates.title: Unit testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create unit tests for the service at [file path] with mocked repository and email service

prompt_templates.title: Complete coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate complete test suite for all files in the [directory] folder including models, routes, and services with proper setup/teardown

output_examples.input: Write tests for the user routes file at src/routes/users.js
output: Generated 3 test files covering user creation, retrieval, update, and deletion
Test cases include: happy paths, validation errors (400), not found (404), authentication failures (401)
Added race condition test for duplicate email handling
Run npm test to verify all tests pass

best_practices: Run infrastructure check first to verify test framework and dependencies
Review generated tests before copying to ensure they match your code structure
Add domain-specific edge cases like timezone handling and date boundaries
Use in-memory MongoDB for integration tests to avoid test pollution
anti_patterns: Do not generate tests without first checking the test framework in package.json
Avoid skipping cleanup between tests which causes test pollution
Do not test implementation details instead of behavior through HTTP interface
Avoid using real database connections in tests which causes side effects

faq.question: Which test frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Jest, Vitest, and Mocha are supported. The skill detects your framework from package.json automatically.

faq.question: What file types can this skill test?
faq.answer: Express routes, controllers, services, models, middleware, and utility functions in Node.js applications.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates test code as output for you to review and copy into your project.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only reads your code structure to generate test patterns. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing after generation?
faq.answer: Ensure you have the required dependencies installed: jest, supertest, and mongodb-memory-server. Check that your package.json has a test script configured.

faq.question: How is this different from other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-generated test patterns customized to your codebase structure rather than generic templates. It considers your actual file organization and imports.
